Name: Alexandria
Description: A major port city on the Mediterranean, known for its historical landmarks and commerce.

Name: Aswan
Description: A southern governorate known for the Aswan Dam and Nubian heritage.

Name: Asyut
Description: A central governorate with a strong agricultural economy.

Name: Beheira
Description: An important agricultural region in the Nile Delta.

Name: Beni Suef
Description: Known for its cement industry and agricultural production.

Name: Cairo
Description: The capital of Egypt, the largest city in Africa, and a major cultural hub.

Name: Dakahlia
Description: A densely populated governorate in the Nile Delta.

Name: Damietta
Description: A coastal governorate known for furniture manufacturing and fishing.

Name: Faiyum
Description: Home to the Qarun Lake and famous for its ancient history.

Name: Gharbia
Description: An industrial and agricultural hub in the Nile Delta.

Name: Giza
Description: Home to the famous Pyramids and Sphinx.

Name: Ismailia
Description: Located along the Suez Canal, an important trade and transport region.

Name: Kafr El Sheikh
Description: An agricultural region in the northern Nile Delta.

Name: Luxor
Description: A historic governorate, home to Karnak and the Valley of the Kings.

Name: Matruh
Description: A vast governorate with coastal resorts and desert landscapes.

Name: Minya
Description: A key agricultural region with significant Pharaonic and Coptic sites.

Name: Monufia
Description: An industrial and agricultural region near Cairo.

Name: New Valley
Description: A sparsely populated governorate in western Egypt.

Name: North Sinai
Description: A strategic region bordering Israel and Gaza.

Name: Port Said
Description: A port city on the Suez Canal with a free trade zone.

Name: Qalyubia
Description: Part of Greater Cairo, known for its agriculture and industry.

Name: Qena
Description: Home to ancient temples and sugarcane production.

Name: Red Sea
Description: A coastal region with tourism hotspots like Hurghada.

Name: Sharqia
Description: One of Egypt most populous regions, with a strong agricultural base.

Name: Sohag
Description: A historic governorate with Pharaonic and Coptic sites.

Name: South Sinai
Description: A tourism hub with Mount Sinai and Sharm El-Sheikh.

Name: Suez
Description: A key trade city at the southern end of the Suez Canal.
